title: Air Liquide acquires PoroGen
text:
Air Liquide acquires PoroGen 15 October 2015 
French industrial gases supplier Air Liquide has acquired US porous polymeric membranes manufacturer PoroGen for an undisclosed amount. 
The acquisition is expected to strengthen Air Liquide's position within the aerospace, refining and petrochemical markets. 
PoroGen membrane technology will complement Air Liquide's MEDAL polymeric membranes. "We are always looking for new opportunities to expand our offers and exceed the needs and expectations of our customers." 
With the new membrane, the company will be able to serve the natural gas industry, particularly the offshore market, with all-membrane solutions from the well-head to the gas pipeline. 
PoroGen technology will strengthen Air Liquide's global research and development network, which are less energy intensive and environment-friendly. 
Air Liquide advanced technologies Ceo Ole Hoefelmann said: "We are happy to announce the acquisition of PoroGen, a company that shares our commitment to innovation in membrane science, and I am pleased to welcome the PoroGen team to the Air Liquide family. 
"We are always looking for new opportunities to expand our offers and exceed the needs and expectations of our customers. 
"The acquisition of PoroGen enables us to further expand our portfolio of industry-leading membrane technologies, as well as our production capacity, to meet growing demand in many sectors." 
PoroGen president Ben Bikson said: "Combining PoroGen and MEDAL technology platforms affords unique synergies and value creation for customers, company employees and shareholders. 
"The technology benefits will now be available to a broad range of global customers." 
PoroGen offers polyether ether ketone (PEEK) based membrane materials for applications including gas separation, gas or liquid transfer, hybrid absorption, nanofiltration, and microfiltration. 
It serves industrial sectors like oil and gas, refining and petrochemicals, energy, power generation, and aerospace. Follow Us:
